title: letting people use fonts online
content:
hi there  
Is it possible to let people use fonts to design a product online.  
Similar to vistaprint.com (well not as big). They won't be able  
to download the fonts or do anything else with them.

The engine in the back will produce a lowres pdf for the  
client and a highres pdf for me.

Are there any legal issues
author: agostini

comments.content: You’ll need to check the license of the fonts to answer this question.

cheers james  
just found this one on linotype

5. Webserver License - Proofing model  
This model allows commercial printers who have a similar webserver model that allows their customers to design template documents (like a greeting card, or business card) and the server only shows the end-user a sample image (gif image for example) to simply “proof” the document. The document is then printed by the commercial printer for their customer. We also license this type of model on an annual contract basis (based on number of fonts, server cpus, and duration of the agreement).

Am I right to say i would have to get a different license for the fonts (all my fonts are standard license, 5 computers)?

<cite>Am I right to say i would have to get a different license for the fonts…</cite>
